summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to attorney Nicolas Bourtin, requesting TD Bank keep specific accounts open for one month due to an ongoing investigation. The accounts are associated with the Butterfly Trust, HBRK Associates Inc, and Aviloop LLC.

persons.name: Nicolas Bourtin
persons.context: The recipient of the letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office, representing the bank (TD Bank) in the matter of keeping certain accounts open for an investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The signatory of the official letter requesting TD Bank keep specific accounts open for an ongoing investigation.

events.title: DOJ Request to Keep Bank Accounts Open
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally requests TD Bank to refrain from closing accounts linked to Butterfly Trust, HBRK Associates Inc, and Aviloop LLC for one month due to an ongoing investigation.

events.title: FinCEN Guidance Issued
events.description: The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) issued guidance (FIN-2007-G002) referenced as the basis for the government's request to keep bank accounts open.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating financial entities (Butterfly Trust, HBRK Associates Inc, Aviloop LLC) linked to the Epstein case as of October 2019.
The government invoked FinCEN guidance to formally request TD Bank keep the subjects' accounts open to avoid jeopardizing the investigation.
The letter instructs the bank not to disclose the request to the account owners or unauthorized third parties, indicating a covert investigative phase.
The listed entities share addresses in New York and New Hampshire, suggesting interconnected financial structures under investigation.
